item.name: corrupt-packets
item.description: Number of corrupt packets received

item.name: deferred-cache-inserts
item.description: Number of cache inserts that were deferred because of maintenance.

item.name: deferred-cache-lookup
item.description: Number of cache lookups that were deferred because of maintenance.

item.name: dnsupdate-answers
item.description: Number of DNS update packets successfully answered.

item.name: dnsupdate-changes
item.description: Total number of changes to records from DNS update.

item.name: dnsupdate-queries
item.description: Number of DNS update packets received.

item.name: dnsupdate-refused
item.description: Number of DNS update packets that were refused.

item.name: key-cache-size
item.description: Number of entries in the key cache.

item.name: latency
item.description: Average number of microseconds a packet spends within PowerDNS.

item.name: meta-cache-size
item.description: Number of entries in the metadata cache.

item.name: packetcache-hit
item.description: Number of packets which were answered out of the cache.

item.name: packetcache-miss
item.description: Number of times a packet could not be answered out of the cache.

item.name: packetcache-size
item.description: Amount of packets in the packetcache.

item.name: qsize-q
item.description: Number of packets waiting for database attention.

item.name: query-cache-hit
item.description: Number of hits on the query cache.

item.name: query-cache-miss
item.description: Number of misses on the query cache.

item.name: rd-queries
item.description: Number of packets sent by clients requesting recursion (regardless of if we'll be providing them with recursion).

item.name: recursing-answers
item.description: Number of packets we supplied an answer to after recursive processing.

item.name: recursing-questions
item.description: Number of packets we performed recursive processing for.

item.name: recursion-unanswered
item.description: Number of packets we sent to our recursor, but did not get a timely answer for.

item.name: security-status
item.description:
Security status based on security polling. https://doc.powerdns.com/md/common/security/#security-polling
0: NXDOMAIN or resolution failure 1: OK 2: Upgrade recommended for security reasons 3: Upgrade mandatory for security reasons

item.name: servfail-packets
item.description: Amount of packets that could not be answered due to database problems.

item.name: signature-cache-size
item.description: Number of entries in the signature cache.

item.name: signatures
item.description: Number of DNSSEC signatures created.

item.name: sys-msec
item.description: Number of CPU milliseconds spent in 'system' mode.

item.name: tcp-answers
item.description: Number of answers sent out over TCP.

item.name: tcp-queries
item.description: Number of questions received over TCP.

item.name: timedout-packets
item.description: Amount of packets that were dropped because they had to wait too long internally.

item.name: timedout-questions
item.description: Amount of questions that were dropped because they had to wait too long internally.

item.name: udp-answers
item.description: Number of answers sent out over UDP.

item.name: udp-answers-bytes
item.description: Total number of answer bytes sent over UDP.

item.name: udp-do-queries
item.description: Number of queries received with the DO (DNSSEC OK) bit set.

item.name: udp-queries
item.description: Number of questions received over UDP.

item.name: udp4-answers
item.description: Number of answers sent out over UDPv4.

item.name: udp4-queries
item.description: Number of questions received over UDPv4.

item.name: udp6-answers
item.description: Number of answers sent out over UDPv6.

item.name: udp6-queries
item.description: Number of questions received over UDPv6.

item.name: uptime
item.description: Uptime in seconds of the daemon.

item.name: user-msec
item.description: Number of CPU milliseconds spent in 'user' mode.

item.name: all-outqueries
item.description: counts the number of outgoing UDP queries since starting

item.name: answers-slow
item.description: counts the number of queries answered after 1 second

item.name: answers0-1
item.description: counts the number of queries answered within 1 millisecond

item.name: answers1-10
item.description: counts the number of queries answered within 10 milliseconds

item.name: answers10-100
item.description: counts the number of queries answered within 100 milliseconds

item.name: answers100-1000
item.description: counts the number of queries answered within 1 second

item.name: cache-bytes
item.description: size of the cache in bytes

item.name: cache-hits
item.description: counts the number of cache hits since starting, this does not include hits that got answered from the packet-cache

item.name: cache-misses
item.description: counts the number of cache misses since starting

item.name: client-parse-errors
item.description: counts number of client packets that could not be parsed

item.name: concurrent-queries
item.description: shows the number of MThreads currently running

item.name: max-mthread-stack
item.description: maximum amount of thread stack ever used

item.name: negcache-entries
item.description: shows the number of entries in the negative answer cache

item.name: nsspeeds-entries
item.description: shows the number of entries in the NS speeds map

item.name: nxdomain-answers
item.description: counts the number of times it answered NXDOMAIN since starting

item.name: outgoing-timeouts
item.description: counts the number of timeouts on outgoing UDP queries since starting

item.name: over-capacity-drops
item.description: questions dropped because over maximum concurrent query limit

item.name: packetcache-bytes
item.description: size of the packet cache in bytes

item.name: packetcache-entries
item.description: size of packet cache

item.name: policy-drops
item.description: packets dropped because of (Lua) policy decision

item.name: qa-latency
item.description: shows the current latency average, in microseconds, exponentially weighted over past 'latency-statistic-size' packets

item.name: questions
item.description: counts all end-user initiated queries with the RD bit set

item.name: resource-limits
item.description: counts number of queries that could not be performed because of resource limits

item.name: security-status
item.description:
Security status based on security polling. https://doc.powerdns.com/md/common/security/#security-polling
0: NXDOMAIN or resolution failure 1: OK 2: Upgrade recommended for security reasons 3: Upgrade mandatory for security reasons

item.name: server-parse-errors
item.description: counts number of server replied packets that could not be parsed

item.name: servfail-answers
item.description: counts the number of times it answered SERVFAIL since starting

item.name: spoof-prevents
item.description: number of times PowerDNS considered itself spoofed, and dropped the data

item.name: sys-msec
item.description: number of CPU milliseconds spent in 'system' mode

item.name: tcp-client-overflow
item.description: number of times an IP address was denied TCP access because it already had too many connections

item.name: tcp-clients
item.description: counts the number of currently active TCP/IP clients

item.name: tcp-outqueries
item.description: counts the number of outgoing TCP queries since starting

item.name: tcp-questions
item.description: counts all incoming TCP queries

item.name: throttle-entries
item.description: shows the number of entries in the throttle map

item.name: throttled-out
item.description: counts the number of throttled outgoing UDP queries since starting

item.name: too-old-drops
item.description: questions dropped that were too old

item.name: unauthorized-tcp
item.description: number of TCP questions denied because of allow-from restrictions

item.name: unauthorized-udp
item.description: number of UDP questions denied because of allow-from restrictions

item.name: unexpected-packets
item.description: number of answers from remote servers that were unexpected (might point to spoofing)

item.name: unreachables
item.description: number of times nameservers were unreachable since starting

item.name: uptime
item.description: number of seconds process has been running

item.name: user-msec
item.description: number of CPU milliseconds spent in 'user' mode
